intro: Piper clivicola, commonly known as the cliff pepper, is a climbing vine native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes many species of pepper plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its fruits are small berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Piper clivicola is often found growing on rocky outcrops and cliffs, where it thrives in well-drained, sunny conditions.
